flavor:
"The altar does nothing; the device is crushed under the weight of its own impurity."
—Ushanti, leonin seer
name: Altar's Light
text: Exile target artifact or enchantment.
title: Altar's Light

flavor:
"Unfortunately, it doesn't restrain the beast's smell."
—Glissa Sunseeker
name: Arrest
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
title: Arrest

flavor: The Auriok have learned through constant struggle that allies are more precious than water.
name: Auriok Bladewarden
text: {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is Auriok Bladewarden's power.
title: Auriok Bladewarden

flavor: They put their safety in his hands. He puts sharpened steel in theirs.
name: Auriok Steelshaper
text:
Equip costs you pay cost {1} less.
As long as Auriok Steelshaper is equipped, each creature you control that's a Soldier or a Knight gets +1/+1.
title: Auriok Steelshaper

flavor: "My grandfather knew enough spells to fill a hundred scrolls. Nowadays, if a spell cannot fight the levelers, it is not even taught to our young."
name: Auriok Transfixer
text: {W}, {T}: Tap target artifact.
title: Auriok Transfixer

flavor: Stunned by the mere presence of the leonin kha, the nim raider quickly fell to its knees.
name: Awe Strike
text: The next time target creature would deal damage this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.
title: Awe Strike

name: Blinding Beam
text:
Choose one —
• Tap two target creatures.
• Creatures don't untap during target player's next untap step.
Entwine {1} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
title: Blinding Beam

flavor: Only leonin clerics who can survive the Razor Fields for one turning of the suns can stand in the Cave of Light.
name: Leonin Abunas
text: Artifacts you control have hexproof. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
title: Leonin Abunas

flavor: No one under the four suns can elude the watchful eye of the den-guard.
name: Leonin Den-Guard
text: As long as Leonin Den-Guard is equipped, it gets +1/+1 and has vigilance.
title: Leonin Den-Guard

flavor:
"The wisdom of the elders is just as much a weapon as a sword or spear. We must learn to wield it."
—Ushanti, leonin seer
name: Leonin Elder
text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield, you may gain 1 life.
title: Leonin Elder

flavor: The skyhunters were born when the first leonin gazed at the heavens and wished to hunt the birds overhead.
name: Leonin Skyhunter
text: Flying
title: Leonin Skyhunter

flavor: The Auriok believe that in the hands of a loxodon, no weapon can be broken.
name: Loxodon Mender
text: {W}, {T}: Regenerate target artifact.
title: Loxodon Mender

name: Loxodon Peacekeeper
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, the player with the lowest life total gains control of Loxodon Peacekeeper. If two or more players are tied for lowest life total, you choose one of them, and that player gains control of Loxodon Peacekeeper.
title: Loxodon Peacekeeper

flavor: The loxodons believe punishment comes in two steps: pain and atonement. They carry a weapon for each.
name: Loxodon Punisher
text: Loxodon Punisher gets +2/+2 for each Equipment attached to it.
title: Loxodon Punisher

name: Luminous Angel
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
title: Luminous Angel

flavor: "The nim raid our homes without warning. We must defend our homes without hesitation."
name: Raise the Alarm
text: Put two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.
title: Raise the Alarm

flavor: "We protect our homelands. Why should they not protect us?"
name: Razor Barrier
text: Target permanent you control gains protection from artifacts or from the color of your choice until end of turn.
title: Razor Barrier

name: Roar of the Kha
text:
Choose one —
• Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
• Untap all creatures you control.
Entwine {1}{W} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
title: Roar of the Kha

flavor: Appointed by the kha himself, members of the tribunal ensure all disputes are settled with the utmost fairness.
name: Rule of Law
text: Each player can't cast more than one spell each turn.
title: Rule of Law

flavor: The bright tunnel sometimes leads back to life.
name: Second Sunrise
text: Each player returns to the battlefield all artifact, creature, enchantment, and land cards in his or her graveyard that were put there from the battlefield this turn.
title: Second Sunrise

flavor: Every young leonin wishes to become a skyhunter, for they soar closest to the suns.
name: Skyhunter Cub
text: As long as Skyhunter Cub is equipped, it gets +1/+1 and has flying.
title: Skyhunter Cub

flavor:
"They are the first to raise the alarm when the levelers attack, and the first to risk their lives to defend the pride."
—Raksha Golden Cub, leonin kha
name: Skyhunter Patrol
text: Flying, first strike (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach, and it deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
title: Skyhunter Patrol

flavor: Instinctively drawn to the light of its "mother-sun," each slith follows that sun's path around Mirrodin.
name: Slith Ascendant
text:
Flying
Whenever Slith Ascendant deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
title: Slith Ascendant

name: Solar Tide
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy all creatures with power 2 or less.
• Destroy all creatures with power 3 or greater.
Entwine—Sacrifice two lands. (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
title: Solar Tide

flavor: Within seconds, the nim was consumed in blinding sunfire. Afterwards, only a puddle of molten iron remained.
name: Soul Nova
text: Exile target attacking creature and all Equipment attached to it.
title: Soul Nova

flavor: Purity rejects artifice.
name: Sphere of Purity
text: If an artifact would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.
title: Sphere of Purity

name: Taj-Nar Swordsmith
text: When Taj-Nar Swordsmith enters the battlefield, you may pay {X}. If you do, search your library for an Equipment card with converted mana cost X or less and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
title: Taj-Nar Swordsmith

flavor:
"This world reeks of another's hand. Someone or something is defying the power of the gods and shaping this planet. I intend for it to stop."
—Glissa Sunseeker
name: Tempest of Light
text: Destroy all enchantments.
title: Tempest of Light

flavor:
"Murder of the living is tragic, but murder of the idea is unforgivable."
—Janus, speaker of the synod
name: Annul
text: Counter target artifact or enchantment spell.
title: Annul

name: Assert Authority
text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.
title: Assert Authority

name: Broodstar
text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Flying
Broodstar's power and toughness are each equal to the number of artifacts you control.
title: Broodstar

flavor: "Be thankful I left you your clothes."
name: Disarm
text: Unattach all Equipment from target creature.
title: Disarm

flavor: Since they haven't seen their original master for millennia, golems are eager to take orders from anyone.
name: Domineer
text:
Enchant artifact creature
You control enchanted artifact creature.
title: Domineer

name: Dream's Grip
text:
Choose one —
• Tap target permanent.
• Untap target permanent.
Entwine {1} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
title: Dream's Grip

flavor: "The secret to invention is to see something in your mind, then find where it hides in the world."
name: Fabricate
text: Search your library for an artifact card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
title: Fabricate

flavor: No one knows what she is watching, but she never takes her eyes off it.
name: Fatespinner
text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, that player chooses draw step, main phase, or combat phase. The player skips each instance of the chosen step or phase this turn.
title: Fatespinner

flavor:
"I wouldn't want you to hurt yourself."
—Bruenna, Neurok leader
name: Inertia Bubble
text:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
title: Inertia Bubble

flavor: Although mute, hoverguards get their message across loud and clear.
name: Looming Hoverguard
text:
Flying
When Looming Hoverguard enters the battlefield, put target artifact on top of its owner's library.
title: Looming Hoverguard

flavor: Information pumps like blood through vedalken society.
name: Lumengrid Augur
text: {1}, {T}: Target player draws a card, then discards a card. If that player discards an artifact card this way, untap Lumengrid Augur.
title: Lumengrid Augur

flavor: The vedalken order their Neurok sentinels to watch over the shores of the Quicksilver Sea, as if they know of intruders yet to come.
name: Lumengrid Sentinel
text:
Flying
Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may tap target permanent.
title: Lumengrid Sentinel

flavor: The Neurok, like the vedalken, are on a constant quest for knowledge. It is their currency, their trade, their life.
name: Lumengrid Warden
title: Lumengrid Warden

name: March of the Machines
text: Each noncreature artifact is an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. (Equipment that's a creature can't equip a creature.)
title: March of the Machines

name: Neurok Familiar
text:
Flying
When Neurok Familiar enters the battlefield, reveal the top card of your library. If it's an artifact card, put it into your hand. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.
title: Neurok Familiar

flavor: From the murk of Mephidross to the heart of Kuldotha, the vedalken send their servants forth to gather knowledge from every inch of Mirrodin.
name: Neurok Spy
text: Neurok Spy can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an artifact.
title: Neurok Spy

flavor: "The Knowledge Pool has all the answers—especially ‘No.'"
name: Override
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each artifact you control.
title: Override

flavor: The vedalken always put their best thought forward.
name: Psychic Membrane
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Psychic Membrane blocks, you may draw a card.
title: Psychic Membrane

name: Quicksilver Elemental
text:
{U}: Quicksilver Elemental gains all activated abilities of target creature until end of turn. (If any of the abilities use that creature's name, use this creature's name instead.)
You may spend blue mana as though it were mana of any color to pay the activation costs of Quicksilver Elemental's abilities.
title: Quicksilver Elemental

flavor:
"Once cast, a spell can be undone. But once revealed, a secret can never again be kept."
—Pontifex, elder researcher
name: Regress
text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
title: Regress

name: Shared Fate
text:
If a player would draw a card, that player exiles the top card of one of his or her opponents' libraries face down instead.
Each player may look at and play cards he or she exiled with Shared Fate.
title: Shared Fate

flavor: A slith's form and function are determined by the color of the sun under which it's born.
name: Slith Strider
text:
Whenever Slith Strider becomes blocked, draw a card.
Whenever Slith Strider deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
title: Slith Strider

flavor: The vedalken interrogate all intruders—once the hoverguards are done with them.
name: Somber Hoverguard
text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Flying
title: Somber Hoverguard

name: Temporal Cascade
text:
Choose one —
• Each player shuffles his or her hand and graveyard into his or her library.
• Each player draws seven cards.
Entwine {2} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
title: Temporal Cascade

flavor: Lymph, the fluid essence of blinkmoths, is prized by wizards for the rush of intellect it provides.
name: Thirst for Knowledge
text: Draw three cards. Then discard two cards unless you discard an artifact card.
title: Thirst for Knowledge

flavor: Vedalken eyes don't see the beauty in things. They see only what those things can teach.
name: Thoughtcast
text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Draw two cards.
title: Thoughtcast

flavor:
"The Knowledge Pool knows. Memnarch understands."
—Janus, speaker of the synod
name: Vedalken Archmage
text: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, draw a card.
title: Vedalken Archmage

flavor: Created by the vedalken to guard Lumengrid, the drones' empty eyes look beyond the Quicksilver Sea.
name: Wanderguard Sentry
text: When Wanderguard Sentry enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand.
title: Wanderguard Sentry

flavor:
"In the game of conquest, who cares about the pawns if the king yet reigns?"
—Geth, keeper of the Vault
name: Barter in Blood
text: Each player sacrifices two creatures.
title: Barter in Blood

name: Betrayal of Flesh
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target creature.
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Entwine—Sacrifice three lands. (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
title: Betrayal of Flesh

name: Chimney Imp
text:
Flying
When Chimney Imp dies, target opponent puts a card from his or her hand on top of his or her library.
title: Chimney Imp

flavor: Mephidross changes all who dwell there, taking their lives and adding them to its own.
name: Consume Spirit
text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Consume Spirit deals X damage to target creature or player and you gain X life.
title: Consume Spirit

flavor: This leash disciplines the master.
name: Contaminated Bond
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature attacks or blocks, its controller loses 3 life.
title: Contaminated Bond

flavor: He stands in the shadow of his lord, Geth, drinking in the dark energies of the Vault.
name: Disciple of the Vault
text: Whenever an artifact is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may have target opponent lose 1 life.
title: Disciple of the Vault

name: Dross Harvester
text:
Protection from white
At the beginning of your end step, you lose 4 life.
Whenever a creature dies, you gain 2 life.
title: Dross Harvester

flavor:
"I would never have believed that on a world with four suns there could exist a place so dark."
—Glissa Sunseeker
name: Dross Prowler
text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
title: Dross Prowler

name: Flayed Nim
text:
Whenever Flayed Nim deals combat damage to a creature, that creature's controller loses that much life.
{2}{B}: Regenerate Flayed Nim.
title: Flayed Nim

name: Grim Reminder
text:
Search your library for a nonland card and reveal it. Each opponent who cast a card this turn with the same name as that card loses 6 life. Then shuffle your library.
{B}{B}: Return Grim Reminder from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
title: Grim Reminder

flavor: The blast ignores the cage of metal but devours the flesh inside.
name: Irradiate
text: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn for each artifact you control.
title: Irradiate

flavor: Many go to Mephidross in search of lost riches. Most end up as part of the cache.
name: Moriok Scavenger
text: When Moriok Scavenger enters the battlefield, you may return target artifact creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
title: Moriok Scavenger

flavor: Mephidross filled with roars of fury and wails of despair as the leonin fought to keep their memories from being pulled into the mists.
name: Necrogen Mists
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player discards a card.
title: Necrogen Mists

name: Nim Devourer
text:
Nim Devourer gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
{B}{B}: Return Nim Devourer from your graveyard to the battlefield, then sacrifice a creature. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
title: Nim Devourer

flavor: The rotting metal feeds the necrogen mists, and in turn the mists feed the nim.
name: Nim Lasher
text: Nim Lasher gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
title: Nim Lasher

flavor: Called "the Dross" by its inhabitants, Mephidross is home to the nim, Mirrodin's mindless, ravenous undead.
name: Nim Shambler
text:
Nim Shambler gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Nim Shambler.
title: Nim Shambler

flavor: As imps they were an annoyance. As nim they are a pestilence.
name: Nim Shrieker
text:
Flying
Nim Shrieker gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
title: Nim Shrieker

name: Promise of Power
text:
Choose one —
• You draw five cards and you lose 5 life.
• Put an X/X black Demon creature token with flying onto the battlefield, where X is the number of cards in your hand.
Entwine {4} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
title: Promise of Power

name: Reiver Demon
text:
Flying
When Reiver Demon enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand, destroy all nonartifact, nonblack creatures. They can't be regenerated.
title: Reiver Demon

flavor: A sword that has seen cowardice in battle exacts the price of honor from its wielder.
name: Relic Bane
text:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact has "At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life."
title: Relic Bane

flavor: Goblins fear the slith, believing they are children banished from the womb of the Steel Mother, deep within Kuldotha.
name: Slith Bloodletter
text:
Whenever Slith Bloodletter deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
{1}{B}: Regenerate Slith Bloodletter.
title: Slith Bloodletter

name: Spoils of the Vault
text: Name a card. Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal the named card, then put that card into your hand. Exile all other cards revealed this way, and you lose 1 life for each of the exiled cards.
title: Spoils of the Vault

flavor:
"A simple trap in a dark corner of the mind, and their nightmares catch up with them."
—Geth, keeper of the Vault
name: Terror
text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
title: Terror

flavor: Mirrodin's artificial environment requires its own predators, scavengers, and senseless forces of nature.
name: Vermiculos
text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield, Vermiculos gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
title: Vermiculos

name: Wail of the Nim
text:
Choose one —
• Regenerate each creature you control.
• Wail of the Nim deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
Entwine {B} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
title: Wail of the Nim

flavor: Blood is thicker than mortar.
name: Wall of Blood
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Pay 1 life: Wall of Blood gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
title: Wall of Blood

name: Woebearer
text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Whenever Woebearer deals combat damage to a player, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
title: Woebearer

flavor: What is the sound of one head snapping?
name: Wrench Mind
text: Target player discards two cards unless he or she discards an artifact card.
title: Wrench Mind

flavor: A shuffling sound and the smell of ozone follow the slogger as surely as its electric tail.
name: Arc-Slogger
text: {R}, Exile the top ten cards of your library: Arc-Slogger deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
title: Arc-Slogger

flavor: On Dominaria, a scavenger. On Mirrodin, a predator.
name: Atog
text: Sacrifice an artifact: Atog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
title: Atog

name: Confusion in the Ranks
text: Whenever an artifact, creature, or enchantment enters the battlefield, its controller chooses target permanent another player controls that shares a card type with it. Exchange control of those permanents.
title: Confusion in the Ranks

flavor: The goblins have forty-two different words for "ow."
name: Detonate
text: Destroy target artifact with converted mana cost X. It can't be regenerated. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.
title: Detonate

flavor: It's hard to avoid electric shock when the entire plane is metallic.
name: Electrostatic Bolt
text: Electrostatic Bolt deals 2 damage to target creature. If it's an artifact creature, Electrostatic Bolt deals 4 damage to it instead.
title: Electrostatic Bolt

name: Fiery Gambit
text: Flip a coin until you lose a flip or choose to stop flipping. If you lose a flip, Fiery Gambit has no effect. If you win one or more flips, Fiery Gambit deals 3 damage to target creature. If you win two or more flips, Fiery Gambit deals 6 damage to each opponent. If you win three or more flips, draw nine cards and untap all lands you control.
title: Fiery Gambit

flavor: Gron's mind reeled with possibilities, most of which are best left unmentioned.
name: Fists of the Anvil
text: Target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.
title: Fists of the Anvil

name: Forge Armor
text:
As an additional cost to cast Forge Armor, sacrifice an artifact.
Put X +1/+1 counters on target creature, where X is the sacrificed artifact's converted mana cost.
title: Forge Armor

name: Fractured Loyalty
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, that spell or ability's controller gains control of that creature. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
title: Fractured Loyalty

flavor: There's no word in the goblin language for "strategy." Then again, there's no word in the goblin language for "word."
name: Goblin Striker
text: First strike, haste
title: Goblin Striker

name: Grab the Reins
text:
Choose one —
• Until end of turn, you gain control of target creature and it gains haste.
• Sacrifice a creature. Grab the Reins deals damage equal to that creature's power to target creature or player.
Entwine {2}{R} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
title: Grab the Reins

name: Incite War
text:
Choose one —
• Creatures target player controls attack this turn if able.
• Creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn.
Entwine {2} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
title: Incite War

flavor: The more weapons a goblin breaks in battle, the more respected he becomes.
name: Krark-Clan Grunt
text: Sacrifice an artifact: Krark-Clan Grunt gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
title: Krark-Clan Grunt

flavor: "What do you mean, we're out of stuff to melt down? Give me your leg."
name: Krark-Clan Shaman
text: Sacrifice an artifact: Krark-Clan Shaman deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
title: Krark-Clan Shaman

flavor: The sooner you see the whites of their eyes, the sooner you'll spill the red of their blood.
name: Mass Hysteria
text: All creatures have haste.
title: Mass Hysteria

flavor: In an ironic bit of evolution, the megatog's dozens of teeth are mainly ornamental. It prefers swallowing things whole.
name: Megatog
text: Sacrifice an artifact: Megatog gets +3/+3 and gains trample until end of turn.
title: Megatog

flavor: When the molten rains fall, entire landscapes melt and flow away in rivulets of fire.
name: Molten Rain
text: Destroy target land. If that land was nonbasic, Molten Rain deals 2 damage to the land's controller.
title: Molten Rain

flavor: When the goblins need more scrap for the Great Furnace, they simply let the ogres loose and follow in their wake.
name: Ogre Leadfoot
text: Whenever Ogre Leadfoot becomes blocked by an artifact creature, destroy that creature.
title: Ogre Leadfoot

flavor: It has an iron stomach. Literally.
name: Rustmouth Ogre
text: Whenever Rustmouth Ogre deals combat damage to a player, you may destroy target artifact that player controls.
title: Rustmouth Ogre

flavor: Vulshok mana rituals echo the day when the red sun burst through Mirrodin's surface to take its place in the heavens.
name: Seething Song
text: Add {R}{R}{R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.
title: Seething Song

flavor: Days of planning. Weeks of building. Months of perfecting. Seconds of smashing.
name: Shatter
text: Destroy target artifact.
title: Shatter

flavor: From trinket to trauma.
name: Shrapnel Blast
text:
As an additional cost to cast Shrapnel Blast, sacrifice an artifact.
Shrapnel Blast deals 5 damage to target creature or player.
title: Shrapnel Blast

flavor: The slith incubate in the Great Furnace's heat, emerging on Mirrodin's surface only when the four suns have aligned overhead.
name: Slith Firewalker
text:
Haste
Whenever Slith Firewalker deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
title: Slith Firewalker

flavor: The path of a goblin shaman is a journey through a thousand ways of hurting people.
name: Spikeshot Goblin
text: {R}, {T}: Spikeshot Goblin deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.
title: Spikeshot Goblin

flavor: Goblins generally have two possessions: one per hand.
name: Trash for Treasure
text:
As an additional cost to cast Trash for Treasure, sacrifice an artifact.
Return target artifact card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
title: Trash for Treasure

flavor: "I could demonstrate how the leonin sunsplicer works, but then you'd be too dead to buy one."
name: Vulshok Battlemaster
text:
Haste
When Vulshok Battlemaster enters the battlefield, attach all Equipment on the battlefield to it. (Control of the Equipment doesn't change.)
title: Vulshok Battlemaster

flavor: He experiences every emotion with passion and repays every slight with vengeance.
name: Vulshok Berserker
text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
title: Vulshok Berserker

name: War Elemental
text:
When War Elemental enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless an opponent was dealt damage this turn.
Whenever an opponent is dealt damage, put that many +1/+1 counters on War Elemental.
title: War Elemental

flavor: "I would gladly die for the forest, but I'm much better at killing for it."
name: Battlegrowth
text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
title: Battlegrowth

flavor: To study the predators of the Tangle, two people are required: one to watch from above, and one to run like hell.
name: Bloodscent
text: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
title: Bloodscent

flavor: In a strange twist of fate, one of the most annoying creatures in the multiverse was brought to the place where it could cause the most damage.
name: Brown Ouphe
text: {1}{G}, {T}: Counter target activated ability from an artifact source. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
title: Brown Ouphe

flavor: Like all forest beasts, it lives by one rule: if there's no room to grow, make some.
name: Copperhoof Vorrac
text: Copperhoof Vorrac gets +1/+1 for each untapped permanent your opponents control.
title: Copperhoof Vorrac

flavor: The deadliest force on Mirrodin isn't the largest organism—it's the smallest.
name: Creeping Mold
text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
title: Creeping Mold

flavor: "Nothing in this world, not even magic, likes to be caged."
name: Deconstruct
text: Destroy target artifact. Add {G}{G}{G} to your mana pool.
title: Deconstruct

flavor: Big ones hunt the elves, so the elves hunt the small ones to keep them from getting big.
name: Fangren Hunter
text: Trample
title: Fangren Hunter

flavor: "There's a secret at the heart of this world, and I will unlock it."
name: Glissa Sunseeker
text:
First strike
{T}: Destroy target artifact if its converted mana cost is equal to the amount of mana in your mana pool.
